meanings.definition: To move or push with force or haste.
meanings.sent1: She hirsles the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent2: The crowd hirsles towards the entrance of the stadium.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel hirsles through the branches to find nuts.
meanings.sent4: The wind hirsles through the trees, bending them slightly.
meanings.sent5: The determined ant hirsles the food crumb back to its nest.

meanings.sent1: The students hirsles to get to the front of the line.
meanings.sent2: The busy market street is filled with people hirsling to buy goods.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppies hirsle each other in the yard.
meanings.sent4: The cars hirsle along the highway during rush hour.
meanings.sent5: The children hirsle for a better view of the parade.

meanings.definition: To crowd or press closely together.
meanings.sent1: The fans hirsle around the stage to see the singer up close.
meanings.sent2: The passengers hirsle into the train during peak hours.
meanings.sent3: The sheep hirsle together for warmth in the cold barn.
meanings.sent4: The colorful fish hirsle around the coral reef in a synchronized dance.
meanings.sent5: The leaves hirsle together in a pile on the windy autumn day.
